results.title: Women in sports an informal history
results.creator_credit: Arthur Zitrin, Dan Klugherz and Altana Films
results.brief_description: Surveys the participation of women in sports from classical times to the present day. Discusses prejudice against the physically active woman, the growing awareness of women’s rights as sports participants, and the new enthusiasm of women for sports. Incorporates archival footage and drawings and features famous sportswomen including, Sonja Henie, Margaret Smith-Court, and Billie Jean King.

results.title: With gentle majesty
results.brief_description: This film recalls the hey-day of the working horse at the turn of the century, and reflects on the decreasing number used today. The title is from Shakespeare’s lines: “Sometimes he trots, as if he told the steps, with gentle majesty and modest pride”. Narrated by Wynn Roberts. (Award: AFI Silver Award)

results.title: Witch doctor
results.brief_description: Choreographic interpretation of voodoo ritual performed by Haitian witch doctor, danced by Jean Leon Destine, to rid a woman possessed of an eil spirit. Accompanied by music of drums.

results.title: Wisconsin: the good life
results.creator_credit: Dick Durrance and Dick Durrance Films
results.brief_description: A survey of Wisconsin - touches briefly the story of the States and the present agricultural and industrial riches. Shows scenes of Milwaukee, an ocean-going port in the heart of the mid-west; Madison, the capital and centre of public life and the varied opportunities for winter and summer sports.

results.title: Wirritt Wirritt
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian National Film Board and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: The aboriginal legend of how fire came under man’s control, illustrated by aboriginal cave painting. The musical background was recorded in Arnhem Land by Professor Elkin. The story is that at first only one man could make fire, and jealously guarded it. However, by a trick Wirritt Wirritt (an ancestral hero) stole the secret for all men’s use. Narrated by Ray Barrett.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Otton, Australian National Film Board and Australian news and Information Bureau

results.title: Wings to Bermuda
results.creator_credit: Harry L. Coleman and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: A young couple spend their honeymoon in Bermuda. The camera follows them as they observe the beauty of the island’s flower gardens, visit caves, play golf, swim, surf or water ski. Exploring the hidden world bellows the sea is a highlight of the tour, as is a midnight barbecue under a full Bermuda moon.

results.title: Wingate, I love you
results.creator_credit: C B Wismar and Counterpoint Films
results.brief_description: Uses the experiences of a young man running away from family discord in order to emphasise the need of people to express their love for one another.

results.title: Window into space: the Parkes radio telescope
results.creator_credit: David Corke, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description: The 210-foot Parkes Radio Telescope is one of the largest steerable instruments in the world and the largest in the Southern Hemisphere, a parabolic antenna suitable for a wide range of wavelengths, which may be directed with high precision over most of the visible sky. How the installation works is explained briefly and the significance of some observations made with it is discussed.

results.title: William Shakespeare, background for his works
results.brief_description: Shows the places of Shakespeare’s times and the elements of his English life that gave the poet-playwright his language and shaped his character. Kenilworth Castle, Stratford, the River Avon, the Anne Hathaway cottage and a model of the original Globe Theatre are portrayed. Brief episodes are presented from some of the plays of Shakespeare: “Romeo and Juliet”, “Macbeth”, “Taming of the Shrew”, “The Merchant of Venice”, and “Hamlet”.
